comment.en-US: A resource that states a capability or behavior that an actor may learn or be able to do within a given context with references to potential levels of competence, a mastery threshold, and other contextualizing metadata.

note.en-US: Comment: Actors may include persons, teams and organizations.

comment.en-US: A resource that identifies a collection of logically related Competency Definitions, Competency Associations, and contextualizing metadata.
A resource that defines a relationship between two resources.

note.@en-US: Comment: The ResourceAssociation is used to relate one CompetencyDefinition to another CompetencyDefinition or to any other resource within or without a CompetencyFramework including resources such as controlled vocabulary terms (concepts), jobs, and assessment instruments

comment.en-US: A set of criteria or indicators that assist in determining whether an entity possesses a given competence or level of proficiency in a task or work product.

note.en-US: Comment: A Rubric may have one or more instances of RubricCriterion.

comment.en-US: A single criterion by which one aspect of an entityâ€™s competence may be evaluated.

note.en-US: Comment: Points to any number of instances of RubricCriterionLevel.

comment.en-US: A degree or level of competence.
Type of the association between two resources.
Original competency framework which this resource is based on or derived from.
Textual label for the category by which rubricCriterion may be grouped.

note.@en-US: Comment: The data value may be expressed in multiple languages with no more than one instance per language.

comment.en-US: Url of a CompetencyAssociation used within this resource.
CompetencyDefinition within this framework.
CompetencyFramework to which this item belongs.
A human readable expression that describes a competency.

note.en-US: This property is an unstructured, literal text of the CompetencyDefinition. The data value may be expressed in multiple languages with no more than one instance per language.

comment.en-US: An established standard to which the described resource conforms.

note.en-US: This term may be used as either a property on CompetencyDefinition or as a concept value of the associationType property on CompetencyAssociation.

comment.en-US: A narrative in plain language that describes and may contextualize the resource.

note.en-US: The data value may be expressed in multiple languages with no more than one instance per language.

comment.en-US: URL of the destination node in a CompetencyAssociation.
Predefined feedback text to be relayed to the person or organization being evaluated. This may include guidance and suggestions for improvement or development.
The destination resource is a member of this resource.

note.en-US: This property implies that the member belongs to the source but does not necessarily define it. This list of all the members does not imply the whole of the source.

comment.en-US: The destination competenceis a part of the competence defined in this source.

note.en-US:
Non-Normative Note: This may be used for example to declare that a "task" is part of a "job" OR  a "skill" is part of a "task" OR  a Measure of Effectiveness is part of a "skill" definition. This implies that all of the child objects define the parent object.

This term may be used as either a property on CompetencyDefinition or as a concept value of the associationType property on CompetencyAssociation.

comment.en-US: The origin framework has a subframework identified by the destination.

note.en-US:
The hasSubframework property shall not be used unless both source and destination are CompetencyFrameworks.

This term may be used as either a property on CompetencyDefinition or as a concept value of the associationType property on CompetencyAssociation.

comment.en-US: A globally unique uri that allows a system to retrieve or reference the resource.

note.en-US: The value shall be unique across all systems that store or process the competency definition. In a JSON-LD serialization, this will be @id.

comment.en-US: The destination resource supports the ability to do or learn the source competency.

note.en-US: This term may be used as either a property on CompetencyDefinition or as a concept value of the associationType property on CompetencyAssociation.

comment.en-US: Indicates if the rubric is designed for manual or automated evaluation of a proficiency level.
The name of the resource.
A numeric value representing this criterion's ordinal position in the criteria list for this rubric.

A human-decipherable identifier that uses a set of semantically cohesive categories or facets that are meaningfully combined, such as "Math.G.C.A.2."  interpreted as subject=Mathematics, category=Geometry, strand=Circles, sub-strand=Arcs and an instance number
The destination resource is essential before having the ability to do or learn the origin resource.

note.en-US: This term may be used as either a property on CompetencyDefinition or as a concept value of the associationType property on CompetencyAssociation.

comment.en-US: URL a Rubric object.
Url of a rubricCriterion object.
Url of a rubricCriterionLevel object.
The points awarded for achieving this level.

note:.en-US: Numeric - up to 3 digits after decimal

comment.en-US: URL of the origin node in a CompetencyAssociation.

note.en-US:
The label may indicate the CompetencyDefinition level in a hierarchical framework (e.g. "subject", "strand", "standard", "benchmark", "indicator") its functional class (e.g. "condition", "context", "criteria", "outcome"), or category (e.g. "knowledge", "skill", "ability", "behavior", "habit of practice").

The data value may be expressed in multiple languages with no more than one instance per language.

comment.en-US: URI of the type or category of the competency

note.en-US: A globally unique identifier for the type, class, or category of the competency. The referenced resource may indicate the CompetencyDefinition level in a hierarchical framework (e.g. "subject", "strand", "standard", "benchmark", "indicator") its functional class (e.g. "condition", "context", "criteria", "outcome"), or category (e.g. "knowledge", "skill", "ability", "behavior", "habit of practice"). It is a URI that may be a resolvable URL to CompetencyFramework metadata in linked data implementations.

comment.en-US: Indicates the relative significance this connection has for the destination node in a learning map.
